DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Щ professora associada do Departamento de Sistemas de Computaчуo do Instituto de Ciъncias Matemсticas e de Computaчуo da Universidade de Sуo Paulo (ICMC/USP). Atua no Programa de Pѓs-Graduaчуo em Ciъncias de Computaчуo e Matemсtica Computacional do ICMC/USP (Nэvel 6 da Capes) como orientadora de alunos de mestrado e doutorado e como responsсvel ministrando disciplinas de pѓs-graduaчуo. Tambщm щ co-orientadora de alunos de mestrado e doutorado do PhD-Program of Computer Science e do Regular Master in Computer Science da Universidade de Kaiserslautern, Alemanha, e do Groningen Graduate School of Science da Universidade de Groningen, Holanda. Щ curadora do Museu de Computaчуo do ICMC/USP e participa ativamente de atividades de cultura e extensуo da USP, alщm de ser coordenadora de projetos de cultura e extensуo nos њltimos cinco anos. Щ coordenadora do Projeto Memѓria Virtual. Tem sido paraninfa e professora homenageada de turmas de graduaчуo. Щ assessora cientэfica da Fundaчуo de Amparo р Pesquisa do Estado de Sуo Paulo (FAPESP) e da Fundaчуo de Amparo р Ciъncia e Tecnologia do Estado de Pernambuco (FACEPE), membro de comitъs de programa de vсrias conferъncias e workshops e revisora de revistas nacionais e internacionais, tais como a IEEE Software, IEEE Transactions on Software Engineering (TSE), Computer, JSS (Journal of Systems and Software), DKE (Data & Knowledge Engineering) Journal e J.UCS (Journal of Universal Computer Science). Щ coordenadora de projetos de pesquisa financiados pela FAPESP e pelo Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientэfico e Tecnolѓgico (CNPq). Щ tambщm coordenadora de um projeto internacional financiado pela Coordenaчуo de Aperfeiчoamento de Pessoal de Nэvel Superior (Capes) e pela Netherlands Universities Foundation for International Cooperation (Nuffic). Em termos de formaчуo acadъmica, conduziu seu projeto de pѓs-doutorado em 2014-2015 na Universitщ de Bretagne-Sud, Franчa, e em 2011-2012 na Fraunhofer Institute for Experimental Software Engineering (Fraunhofer IESE), Alemanha. Possui o tэtulo de livre docъncia (2013), de doutor (2006) e de mestre (1998) em Ciъncias de Computaчуo e Matemсtica Computacional pela USP. Щ bacharel em Ciъncias de Computaчуo tambщm pela USP (1994). Tem experiъncia na сrea de Engenharia de Software, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: arquitetura de software, arquitetura de referъncia, sistemas-de-sistemas, linha de produto de software, teste de software, ontologia e software livre. Dentre os temas pesquisados, tem-se destacado com publicaчѕes relacionadas ao estabelecimento, representaчуo, avaliaчуo e utilizaчуo de arquiteturas de referъncia. Possui artigos publicados em anais de conferъncias e revistas internacionais importantes da сrea, podendo-se citar o JSS, ACM/SAC (ACM Symposium on Applied Computing), WICSA (IEEE/IFIP Conference on Software Architecture) e ECSA (European Conference on Software Architecture). Щ membro da Sociedade Brasileira de Computaчуo (SBC) e da IEEE Computer Society. Щ tambщm representante institucional da SBC no ICMC/USP.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Ciъncias de Computaчуo from Universidade de Sуo Paulo /ICMC (1994), master's at Ciъncias de Computaчуo e Matemсtica Computacional from Universidade de Sуo Paulo /ICMC (1998) and doctorate at Ciъncias de Computaчуo e Matemсtica Computacional from Universidade de Sуo Paulo /ICMC (2006). He is currently professor doutor at Universidade de Sуo Paulo. Has experience in Computer Science, focusing on Computer Science, acting on the following subjects: arquitetura de referъncia, arquitetura de software, reference architecture, requisito arquitetural and desenvolvimento orientado a aspectos.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT: Software documentation has a high impact in software maintenance, costs and quality, as well as it has been required by important capability maturity models. In another perspective, Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has arisen, intending to contribute to development of reusable, maintainable and evolvable systems. In this context, Aspect-Oriented Frameworks (AOF) has been developed, aggregating reusability, maintainability and evolvability brought in by AOP. In this paper, we have proposed the design of an AOF for software documentation and have used it to build a tool to document testing activity. Issues related to reuse and evolution of this framework to other software engineering activities are discussed. This work is part of a wider scope that proposes the use of AOFs to develop software engineering tools. These AOFs compose a reference architecture for SEE (Software Engineering Environment), named RefASSET (Reference Architecture for Software Engineering Tools), that intends to provide an incremental development of evolvable SEEs.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT: Software documentation has a high impact in software maintenance, costs and quality, as well as it has been required by important capability maturity models. In another perspective, Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has arisen, intending to contribute to development of reusable, maintainable and evolvable systems. In this context, Aspect-Oriented Frameworks (AOF) has been developed, aggregating reusability, maintainability and evolvability brought in by AOP. In this paper, we have proposed the design of an AOF for software documentation and have used it to build a tool to document testing activity. Issues related to reuse and evolution of this framework to other software engineering activities are discussed. This work is part of a wider scope that proposes the use of AOFs to develop software engineering tools. These AOFs compose a reference architecture for SEE (Software Engineering Environment), named RefASSET (Reference Architecture for Software Engineering Tools), that intends to provide an incremental development of evolvable SEEs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Exploring Ontologies to Support the Establishment of Reference Architecture: An Example on Software Testing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Exploring Ontologies to Support the Establishment of Reference Architecture: An Example on Software Testing

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE/IFIP Conference on Software Architecture 2009 & European Conference on Software Architecture 2009 (WICSA/ECSA 2009)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IEEE/IFIP Conference on Software Architecture 2009 & European Conference on Software Architecture 2009 (WICSA/ECSA 2009)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT: Software architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In particular, reference architectures have emerged, achieving well-recognized understanding in a specific domain, promoting reuse of design expertise and facilitating the development of systems. In another perspective, ontologies have been widely investigated aiming at representing, communicating and reusing knowledge. In spite of their relevance on directly dealing with domain knowledge, reference architectures and ontologies have been separately treated. In this paper we investigate the impact in using ontologies to the establishment of reference architectures. We illustrate our idea using an ontology of software testing to build a reference architecture for the testing domain. Preliminary results indicate that ontologies are an important and viable mechanism aiming at building reference architectures.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT: Software architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In particular, reference architectures have emerged, achieving well-recognized understanding in a specific domain, promoting reuse of design expertise and facilitating the development of systems. In another perspective, ontologies have been widely investigated aiming at representing, communicating and reusing knowledge. In spite of their relevance on directly dealing with domain knowledge, reference architectures and ontologies have been separately treated. In this paper we investigate the impact in using ontologies to the establishment of reference architectures. We illustrate our idea using an ontology of software testing to build a reference architecture for the testing domain. Preliminary results indicate that ontologies are an important and viable mechanism aiming at building reference architectures.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Towards a Process to Design Aspect-Oriented Reference Architectures
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Towards a Process to Design Aspect-Oriented Reference Architectures

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXXV Latin American Informatics Conference (CLEI 2009)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: XXXV Latin American Informatics Conference (CLEI 2009)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT: Since software architecture design is essential in the software development, attention has been taken to this task. There are, however, little initiatives to systematize the reference architecture design, in special, when these architectures include aspects (from AOSD - Aspect-Oriented Software Development) in their structures. This paper presents ProSA-RA, a process to build aspect-oriented reference architectures, systematizing the development, design and evaluation of these architectures. In order to illustrate the feasibility of this process, we illustrate its application in the Visual Mining domain. Positive results have been achieved, mainly related to facilities to build reference architectures and to identify aspects in architectural level.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT: Since software architecture design is essential in the software development, attention has been taken to this task. There are, however, little initiatives to systematize the reference architecture design, in special, when these architectures include aspects (from AOSD - Aspect-Oriented Software Development) in their structures. This paper presents ProSA-RA, a process to build aspect-oriented reference architectures, systematizing the development, design and evaluation of these architectures. In order to illustrate the feasibility of this process, we illustrate its application in the Visual Mining domain. Positive results have been achieved, mainly related to facilities to build reference architectures and to identify aspects in architectural level.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Survey of Evaluation Methods for Specific Software Architectures

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: III Simpѓsio Brasileiro de Componentes, Arquiteturas e Reutilizaчуo de Software (SBCARS 2009)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Uma diversidade de mщtodos de avaliaчуo de arquiteturas de software vъm sendo propostos, visando a qualidade dos sistemas de software. Esforчos para o levantamento, anсlise e comparaчуo desses mщtodos podem tambщm ser encontrados. Contudo, um levantamento mais recente nуo tem sido conduzido. Assim, este artigo tem como principal objetivo a identificaчуo de mщtodos que abordem a avaliaчуo de arquiteturas especэficas e recentes --- a saber arquiteturas de referъncia, arquiteturas orientadas a serviчo e arquiteturas orientadas a aspectos --- considerando-se que nos њltimos anos essas arquiteturas tъm-se tornado alvo tanto de pesquisa quanto de utilizaчуo. Como principal resultado, observou-se que hс ainda uma grande carъncia de mщtodos consolidados e largamente aceitos para a avaliaчуo de tais arquiteturas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: A diversity of methods to software architecture evaluation has been proposed, aiming at the quality of software systems. Efforts to identify, analyse and compare these methods can be also found. However, a more recent study has not been conducted. Thus, in this paper, we aim at identifying methods to evaluate recent and specific architectures --- reference architectures, service-oriented architectures and aspect-oriented architectures --- since in the last years, these architectures have become topics of research, besides broadly used. As main result, we can pointed out that there is a lack of mature and widely accepted methods to evaluate such architectures.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Context: Systematic mapping provides an overview of a research area to assess the quantity of evidence existing on a topic of interest. In spite of its relevance, the establishment of consistent categories and classi cation of primary studies in these categories are manually conducted. Objective: We propose an approach, named SM-VTM (Systematic Mapping based on Visual Text Mining), to support categorization and classi cation stages in the systematic mapping using Visual Text Mining (VTM), aiming at reducing time and effort required in this process. Method: We established SM-VTM, selected a VTM tool and conducted a case study comparing results of two systematic mapping: one performed manually and other using our approach. Results: The results of both systematic mapping were very similar, showing the viability of SM-VTM. Furthermore, since our approach was applied using a tool, reduction of time and effort can be achieved. Conclusions: The application of VTM seems to be very relevant in the context of systematic mapping.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Context: Systematic mapping provides an overview of a research area to assess the quantity of evidence existing on a topic of interest. DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 5th Workshop on SHAring and Reusing architectural Knowledge (SHARK'2010), ACM/IEEE 32nd International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE'2010)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In this perspective, a lot of work have been conducted and considerable knowledge in the software architecture area has been accumulated. In another perspective, systematic mapping is a technique that provides an overview of a research area to assess the quantity of evidence existing on a topic of interest. Thus, the main objetive of this paper is to introduce systematic mapping in order to explore, understand, organize and summarize software architecture knowledge, aiming at contributing to software architecture area. An example of use of this technique is presented and positive results point out to its viability also in the software architecture research area.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has arisen, intending to contribute to the development of reusable, maintainable, and evolvable software systems. Aspects have been also explored in the early life cycle phases, aiming at contributing to more adequate development of aspect-oriented software systems. In this perspective, a diversity of extensions of the UML has been proposed to represent these systems, considering its relevance and dissemination as language to model software systems. However, there is a lack of a complete panorama that identify all these extensions. Thus, this paper intends to present an overview about which are possibly all extensions of the UML to represent aspect-oriented software systems. For this, we have used systematic mapping, a technique proposed by Evidence-Based Software Engineering (EBSE). Achieved results show a diversity of work; however, there is not a consensus about which are the more adequate or more used extensions. Based on this overview, interesting and important perspectives for future research can also be found.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has arisen, intending to contribute to the development of reusable, maintainable, and evolvable software systems. Aspects have been also explored in the early life cycle phases, aiming at contributing to more adequate development of aspect-oriented software systems. In this perspective, a diversity of extensions of the UML has been proposed to represent these systems, considering its relevance and dissemination as language to model software systems. However, there is a lack of a complete panorama that identify all these extensions. Thus, this paper intends to present an overview about which are possibly all extensions of the UML to represent aspect-oriented software systems. For this, we have used systematic mapping, a technique proposed by Evidence-Based Software Engineering (EBSE). Achieved results show a diversity of work; however, there is not a consensus about which are the more adequate or more used extensions. Based on this overview, interesting and important perspectives for future research can also be found.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 14th Workshop on Requirements Engineering (WER 2011) @ 14th Iberoamerican Conference on Software Engineering (CIbSE 2011)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In this context, reference architectures have emerged as a special type of architecture that contains knowledge of a specific domain, aiming at improving reuse and productivity, facilitating the development of systems of that domain. Considering their relevance, the establishment of reference architectures is very interesting; however, it is not a trivial task, mainly due to the difficulty to identify their requirements, since a range of knowledge is required. Thus, the main objective of this paper is to propose the use of Systematic Review as a technique to elicit requirements of reference architectures. In order to show the viability of our idea, we present a case study on the software testing domain. Main achieved results have pointed that Systematic Review could be considered an efficient and additional technique to gather spread domain knowledge, essential task to the establishment of a more complete reference architecture.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In this context, reference architectures have emerged as a special type of architecture that contains knowledge of a specific domain, aiming at improving reuse and productivity, facilitating the development of systems of that domain. Considering their relevance, the establishment of reference architectures is very interesting; however, it is not a trivial task, mainly due to the difficulty to identify their requirements, since a range of knowledge is required. Thus, the main objective of this paper is to propose the use of Systematic Review as a technique to elicit requirements of reference architectures. In order to show the viability of our idea, we present a case study on the software testing domain. Main achieved results have pointed that Systematic Review could be considered an efficient and additional technique to gather spread domain knowledge, essential task to the establishment of a more complete reference architecture.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An Experience of Open Source Development for the Historical Heritage Domain
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: An Experience of Open Source Development for the Historical Heritage Domain

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IADIS International Conference Information Systems (IADIS IS 2011)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: In the last years, Free/Libre/Open Source Software (FLOSS) has sparked considerable interest, mainly due to a diversity of well-known FLOSS projects and the FLOSS Development (FLOSSD) processes conducted in these projects. Considering the success of these processes, their investigation and adoption in different contexts seem also to be promising. In this paper, we present an experience of applying a FLOSSD process to build an information system, more specifically a web system for historical heritage domain in the context of a research project; i.e. in a context quite different from traditional FLOSS projects. Learned lessons and adjustments in the FLOSSD process are discussed, aiming at contributing to processes in similar contexts.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: In the last years, Free/Libre/Open Source Software (FLOSS) has sparked considerable interest, mainly due to a diversity of well-known FLOSS projects and the FLOSS Development (FLOSSD) processes conducted in these projects. Considering the success of these processes, their investigation and adoption in different contexts seem also to be promising. In this paper, we present an experience of applying a FLOSSD process to build an information system, more specifically a web system for historical heritage domain in the context of a research project; i.e. in a context quite different from traditional FLOSS projects. Learned lessons and adjustments in the FLOSSD process are discussed, aiming at contributing to processes in similar contexts.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Proteum/AJ: A Mutation System for AspectJ Programs

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proc. of the 10th International Conference on Aspect-oriented Software Development Companion

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has introduced a complementary set of mechanisms which enhance the modularisation of crosscutting concerns. However, such mechanisms represent new potential sources of faults that may be systematically tackled with mutation testing. In this demonstration we present a tool, named Proteum/AJ, which automates the mutation testing of AspectJ programs. Proteum/AJ supports the main steps of this testing approach and realises a set of requirements for mutation-based testing tools like mutant handling, test case handling and mutant analysis. Our experience in using the tool provided us with evidence on the feasibility of performing mutation testing of AO programs. In this demonstration we are going to share some of this experience with the audience.

Our experience in using the tool provided us with evidence on the feasibility of performing mutation testing of AO programs. In this demonstration we are going to share some of this experience with the audience.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Current State of Reference Architectures in the Context of Agile Methodologies

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software architectures and reference architectures have been playing a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In particular, reference architectures have emerged, achieving well-recognized understanding of specific domains, promoting reuse of design expertise and facilitating the development of systems. In another perspective, agile methodologies have been widely adopted as a promising iterative, incremental and collaborative software development process, including by the software industry. Considering the relevance of reference architectures, initiatives of agile methodologies exploring these architectures are also found. However, there is a lack of a panorama about the uses, impacts and perspectives of such architectures in the agile context. The main objective of this paper is present an detailed view about how reference architectures have been used in the context of agile methodologies. For this, we applied Systematic Review, a technique to systematically explore, organize, summarize, and assess all contributions of a specific research area. As main result, we have observed that reference architecture and agile methodology should be more investigated together. Furthermore, we intend to contribute to open perspectives of new and important research lines.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software architectures and reference architectures have been playing a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In particular, reference architectures have emerged, achieving well-recognized understanding of specific domains, promoting reuse of design expertise and facilitating the development of systems. Considering the relevance of reference architectures, initiatives of agile methodologies exploring these architectures are also found. However, there is a lack of a panorama about the uses, impacts and perspectives of such architectures in the agile context. The main objective of this paper is present an detailed view about how reference architectures have been used in the context of agile methodologies. AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: As video games evolve into richer and more sophisticated products, the software driving those games become more complex. One of the research areas offered by Software Engineering to cope with this complexity, while reducing risks and improving software quality, is Software Architecture. The purpose of this paper is to present an overview of possibly all work having investigated, established and used software architectures for the development of video games. For this, a Systematic Mapping was conducted. The achieved results show an increasing, however still mild, interest in the exploration of software architectures for the development of video games, and lays out lines of research that can be explored.

One of the research areas offered by Software Engineering to cope with this complexity, while reducing risks and improving software quality, is Software Architecture. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Representation of Reference Architectures: A Systematic Review
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Representation of Reference Architectures: A Systematic Review

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 23nd International Conference on Software Engineering and Knowledge Engineering (SEKE 2011)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 23nd International Conference on Software Engineering and Knowledge Engineering (SEKE 2011)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software architectures play a major role in determining system quality, since they form the backbone to any successful software-intensive system. In this context, a reference architecture is a generic architecture for a class of software systems used as a foundation for the design of concrete architectures from this class. Because of their fundamental role, reference architectures need to be properly represented in order to be effectively used, and understood by all stakeholders. In this perspective, we have found initiatives proposing different approaches to represent them. However, there is a lack of detailed overview about all these approaches and an analysis about their effectiveness. In this paper, we identify possibly all approaches used or proposed to represent reference architectures. For this, we have used a technique proposed by Evidence-Based Software Engineering (EBSE): the Systematic Review. As achieved results, we can observe different approaches adopted to represent reference architectures; however, there is not a consensus about which are more adequate or their effectiveness. Based on this overview, interesting and important perspectives for future research can also be found.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software architectures play a major role in determining system quality, since they form the backbone to any successful software-intensive system. In this context, a reference architecture is a generic architecture for a class of software systems used as a foundation for the design of concrete architectures from this class. Because of their fundamental role, reference architectures need to be properly represented in order to be effectively used, and understood by all stakeholders. In this perspective, we have found initiatives proposing different approaches to represent them. However, there is a lack of detailed overview about all these approaches and an analysis about their effectiveness. In this paper, we identify possibly all approaches used or proposed to represent reference architectures. For this, we have used a technique proposed by Evidence-Based Software Engineering (EBSE): the Systematic Review. As achieved results, we can observe different approaches adopted to represent reference architectures; however, there is not a consensus about which are more adequate or their effectiveness. Based on this overview, interesting and important perspectives for future research can also be found.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Service-Oriented Reference Architecture for the Software Testing Domain
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Service-Oriented Reference Architecture for the Software Testing Domain,

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 5th European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA'2011)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proc. of the 5th European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA'2011), ISSN: 0302-9743, e-ISSN: 1611-3349, e-ISBN: 978-3-642-23798-0

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software testing is recognized as a fundamental activity for assuring software quality. Aiming at supporting this activity, a diversity of testing tools has been developed, including tools based on SOA (Service-Oriented Architecture). In another perspective, reference architectures have played a significant role in aggregating knowledge of a given domain, contributing to the success in the development of systems for that domain. There is however a lack of reference architectures for the testing domain that contribute to development of testing tools based on SOA. Thus, the main contribution of this paper is to present a service-oriented reference architecture, named RefTEST-SOA (Reference Architecture for Software Testing Tools based on SOA), that comprises knowledge and experience about how to structure testing tools organized as services and pursues a better integration, scalability and reuse provided by SOA to such tools. Results of our case studies have showed that RefTEST-SOA is a viable and reusable element to development of service-oriented testing tools.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software testing is recognized as a fundamental activity for assuring software quality. Aiming at supporting this activity, a diversity of testing tools has been developed, including tools based on SOA (Service-Oriented Architecture). In another perspective, reference architectures have played a significant role in aggregating knowledge of a given domain, contributing to the success in the development of systems for that domain. There is however a lack of reference architectures for the testing domain that contribute to development of testing tools based on SOA. Thus, the main contribution of this paper is to present a service-oriented reference architecture, named RefTEST-SOA (Reference Architecture for Software Testing Tools based on SOA), that comprises knowledge and experience about how to structure testing tools organized as services and pursues a better integration, scalability and reuse provided by SOA to such tools. Results of our case studies have showed that RefTEST-SOA is a viable and reusable element to development of service-oriented testing tools.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Reference Architecture and Product Line Architecture: A Subtle but Critical Difference
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Reference Architecture and Product Line Architecture: A Subtle but Critical Difference

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 5th European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA'2011)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proc. of the 5th European Conference on Software Architecture (ECSA'2011), ISSN: 0302-9743, e-ISSN: 1611-3349, e-ISBN: 978-3-642-23798-0

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Currently, the size and complexity of software systems, associated with critical time to market, demand, to the Software Engineering discipline, new approaches to build such systems. In this context, the use of reference architectures and product line architectures is becoming a common practice. However, both concepts, most of the time, wrongly faced as the same thing; it is not also clearly established how they could be explored in a complementary way in order to contribute to the improvement of software system development practices. The main contribution of this paper is to make a clear differentiation of these architectures, by highlighting basic questions like definitions, benefits and motivation for using each one, when and how they should be used, built and evolved, as well as stakeholders involved and benefitted by each one. Furthermore, we present an approach to use reference architectures as basis of product line architecture structures. As a result, a better understanding of both reference architecture and product line architecture, as well as how to explore them in a joint way, could promote a more effective reuse when developing software systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Currently, the size and complexity of software systems, associated with critical time to market, demand, to the Software Engineering discipline, new approaches to build such systems. In this context, the use of reference architectures and product line architectures is becoming a common practice. However, both concepts, most of the time, wrongly faced as the same thing; it is not also clearly established how they could be explored in a complementary way in order to contribute to the improvement of software system development practices. The main contribution of this paper is to make a clear differentiation of these architectures, by highlighting basic questions like definitions, benefits and motivation for using each one, when and how they should be used, built and evolved, as well as stakeholders involved and benefitted by each one. Furthermore, we present an approach to use reference architectures as basis of product line architecture structures. As a result, a better understanding of both reference architecture and product line architecture, as well as how to explore them in a joint way, could promote a more effective reuse when developing software systems.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Development of a Complex System based on Architectural And Design Patterns
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Development of a Complex System based on Architectural And Design Patterns

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS International Conference Applied Computing (IADIS AC 2011)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IADIS International Conference Applied Computing (IADIS AC 2011)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: This paper presents HVDC-Sim, a complex system that aims at simulating the control desk for an HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) Power System. The HVDC-Sim has a very complex single interface that is responsible for simulating the real control desk that monitors information of an entire power system. In addition to the inherent complexity of the interface, another challenge faced by the development team was the need to deal with mutable requirements. To support the development of a robust and extensible system simulator we have focused on the design, using architectural and design patterns. These patterns have been considered as an important element in order to provide a more adequate solution in the system architecture and design. Experiences reporting the use of architectural and design patterns in a complex system is interesting and aims at contributing to reply the same experience in other situations. Thus, the main objective of this paper is to present our experience using these patterns in the development of the HVDC-Sim. As result, we can point out that these patterns were essentially important in order to facilitate the development, resulting in an extensible system that is currently in use by Furnas Centrais Elщtricas, the major company that generates and transmits electricity in Brazil.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: This paper presents HVDC-Sim, a complex system that aims at simulating the control desk for an HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) Power System. DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2nd International Workshop on Knowledge-Oriented Product Line Engineering (KOPLE 2011) @ 15th International Software Product Line Conference (SPLC 2011)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software Product Line (SPL) has arisen as an approach for developing a family of software-intensive systems at lower costs, within shorter time, and with higher quality. In particular, SPL is supported by a product line architecture (sometimes also referred to as reference architecture) that captures the architectures of a product family. In another context, a special type of architecture that contains knowledge about a speci c domain has been increasingly investigated, resulting in the Reference Architecture research area. In spite of the positive impact of this type of architecture on reuse and productivity, the use of existing domain-speci c reference architectures as basis of SPL has not been widely explored. The main contribution of this paper is to present how and when elements contained in existing reference architectures could contribute to the building of SPL artifacts during development of an SPL. We have observed that, in fact, reference architectures could make an important contribution to improving reuse and productivity, which are also important concerns in SPL.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software Product Line (SPL) has arisen as an approach for developing a family of software-intensive systems at lower costs, within shorter time, and with higher quality. In spite of the positive impact of this type of architecture on reuse and productivity, the use of existing domain-speci c reference architectures as basis of SPL has not been widely explored. The main contribution of this paper is to present how and when elements contained in existing reference architectures could contribute to the building of SPL artifacts during development of an SPL. We have observed that, in fact, reference architectures could make an important contribution to improving reuse and productivity, which are also important concerns in SPL.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Producing high quality software systems has been one of the most important software development concerns. In this perspective, Software Architecture and Software Testing are two important research areas that have contributed in that direction. The attention given to the software architecture has played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. Otherwise, software testing has been recognized as a fundamental activity for assuring the software quality; however, it is an expensive, error-prone, and time consuming activity. For this reason, a diversity of testing tools and environments has been developed in the last years; however, they have been almost always designed without an adequate attention to their evolution, maintenance, reuse, and mainly to their architectures. Thus, this paper presents our main contributions to systematize the development of testing tools and environments, aiming at improving their quality, reuse, and productivity. In particular, we have addressed architectures for software testing tools and environments and have also developed and made available testing tools. Moreover, we state perspectives of research in this area, including open research issues that must be treated, considering the unquestionable relevance of testing automation to the testing activity.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Producing high quality software systems has been one of the most important software development concerns. In this perspective, Software Architecture and Software Testing are two important research areas that have contributed in that direction. For this reason, a diversity of testing tools and environments has been developed in the last years; however, they have been almost always designed without an adequate attention to their evolution, maintenance, reuse, and mainly to their architectures. Thus, this paper presents our main contributions to systematize the development of testing tools and environments, aiming at improving their quality, reuse, and productivity. In particular, we have addressed architectures for software testing tools and environments and have also developed and made available testing tools. Moreover, we state perspectives of research in this area, including open research issues that must be treated, considering the unquestionable relevance of testing automation to the testing activity.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Muitas das funчѕes presentes em um computador pessoal foram transportadas para os telefones celulares. No Brasil, o nњmero de telefones celulares vendidos щ maior que o nњmero de telefones fixos. No entanto, muitas das funcionalidades disponibilizadas em software de telefones celulares nуo sуo utilizadas. Щ importante que sejam observados aspectos de usabilidade nessas aplicaчѕes. Nesse sentido, este artigo apresenta uma revisуo sistemсtica sobre mщtodos de avaliaчуo de usabilidade aplicados em software de telefones celulares. Considerando questѕes sobre quais mщtodos de avaliaчуo de usabilidade tъm sido empregados, quais os problemas mais recorrentes encontrados nas avaliaчѕes e quais as soluчѕes apontadas, este artigo apresenta os resultados de busca em cinco bases de conhecimento cientэfico, que resultaram em 221 trabalhos relacionados, sendo que 21 foram incluэdos, 93 excluэdos e 107 considerados repetidos. Os resultados da anсlise sugerem que menos da metade das avaliaчѕes realizadas consideram mщtodos tradicionais como a Avaliaчуo Heurэstica, os problemas mais mencionados estуo relacionados com a navegaчуo e a visibilidade dos elementos de interface e apenas 30% dos trabalhos apontam sugestѕes para a resoluчуo dos problemas encontrados.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: In the Ambient Assisted Living (AAL) domain, specific systems have been developed and applied to enable people with specific needs, such as elderly or disabled people, to live longer independently in their familiar residential environments. In order to support the development of such systems, a range of AAL platforms have been developed in recent years. However, there are considerable differences among these AAL platforms, particularly with respect to the treatment of important non-functional properties. This makes the selection of a suitable platform for a given AAL project very difficult. In order to support developers in this difficult task, we present an evaluation of relevant AAL platforms based on a selection of quality attributes that are important for AAL systems.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: In the Ambient Assisted Living (AAL) domain, specific systems have been developed and applied to enable people with specific needs, such as elderly or disabled people, to live longer independently in their familiar residential environments. AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software architectures play a major role in determining system quality, since they form the backbone of any successful software-intensive system. In this context, reference architectures refer to a special type of software architecture that capture the essence of the system architectures of a given domain, encompassing the knowledge about how to develop, standardize, and evolve systems of that domain. However, in spite of the considerable number of reference architectures available, no good understanding exists regarding knowledge contained in reference architectures. The main contribution of this work is to provide a better understanding of such knowledge and to propose a framework which presents a comprehensive panorama of this knowledge. An analysis of this framework is presented based on a relevant, well-known reference architecture widely used in industry. As its main result, this framework could provide a better understanding of the contents of such architectures, enabling the development of more complete, efficient reference architectures.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: REIC. Revista Eletrєnica de Iniciaчуo Cientэfica (Online)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Software documentation has a high impact in software maintenance, quality and costs. Besides, it has been required by important capability maturity models. In another perspective, Aspect-Oriented Software Development has arisen, intending to contribute to development of reusable, maintainable and evolvable systems, based on a better separation of concerns. Thus, considering software documentation as a crosscutting concern seems to be promising. This paper presents ATDoc (Aspect-oriented Testing Documentation tool), a web tool that automates documentation of the software testing activity, considering the ideia of the documentation as a crosscutting concern. Perspectives of extending this tool for other Software Engineering activities are also discussed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Software documentation has a high impact in software maintenance, quality and costs. Besides, it has been required by important capability maturity models. In another perspective, Aspect-Oriented Software Development has arisen, intending to contribute to development of reusable, maintainable and evolvable systems, based on a better separation of concerns. Thus, considering software documentation as a crosscutting concern seems to be promising. This paper presents ATDoc (Aspect-oriented Testing Documentation tool), a web tool that automates documentation of the software testing activity, considering the ideia of the documentation as a crosscutting concern. Perspectives of extending this tool for other Software Engineering activities are also discussed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: An Aspect-oriented Reference Architecture for Software Engineering Environments
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: An Aspect-oriented Reference Architecture for Software Engineering Environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: The Journal of Systems and Software

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Reusable and evolvable Software Engineering Environments (SEEs) are essential to software production and have increasingly become a need. In another perspective, software architectures and reference architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In this paper we present a reference architecture for SEEs, named RefASSET, which is based on concepts coming from the aspect-oriented approach. This architecture is specialized to the software testing domain and the development of tools for that domain is discussed. This and other case studies have pointed out that the use of aspects in RefASSET provides a better separation of concerns, resulting in reusable and evolvable SEEs.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Reusable and evolvable Software Engineering Environments (SEEs) are essential to software production and have increasingly become a need. In another perspective, software architectures and reference architectures have played a significant role in determining the success of software systems. In this paper we present a reference architecture for SEEs, named RefASSET, which is based on concepts coming from the aspect-oriented approach. This architecture is specialized to the software testing domain and the development of tools for that domain is discussed. This and other case studies have pointed out that the use of aspects in RefASSET provides a better separation of concerns, resulting in reusable and evolvable SEEs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Extensions of UML to Model Aspect-oriented Software Systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Extensions of UML to Model Aspect-oriented Software Systems

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has arisen as a new technology to support a better SoC (Separation of Concerns), intending to contribute to the development of reusable, maintainable, and evolvable software systems. Aspects have been also explored in the early life cycle phases, aiming at contributing to a more adequate development of aspect-oriented software systems. In this perspective, in order to better represent these systems, a diversity of extensions of the UML (Unified Modeling Language) has been proposed; however, there is a lack of a complete panorama that identify all these extensions. This paper presents an overview about which are possibly all extensions of the UML to represent aspect-oriented software systems. For this, we have used a technique proposed by Evidence-Based Software Engineering (EBSE): the Systematic Mapping. As achieved results, we can observe a diversity of work; however, there is not a consensus about which are the more adequate or more used extensions. Based on this overview, interesting and important perspectives for future research can also be found.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) has arisen as a new technology to support a better SoC (Separation of Concerns), intending to contribute to the development of reusable, maintainable, and evolvable software systems. Aspects have been also explored in the early life cycle phases, aiming at contributing to a more adequate development of aspect-oriented software systems. In this perspective, in order to better represent these systems, a diversity of extensions of the UML (Unified Modeling Language) has been proposed; however, there is a lack of a complete panorama that identify all these extensions. This paper presents an overview about which are possibly all extensions of the UML to represent aspect-oriented software systems. For this, we have used a technique proposed by Evidence-Based Software Engineering (EBSE): the Systematic Mapping. As achieved results, we can observe a diversity of work; however, there is not a consensus about which are the more adequate or more used extensions. Based on this overview, interesting and important perspectives for future research can also be found.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: Um Sistema de Injeчуo de Defeitos de Software Baseado em Operadores de Mutaчуo

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Injeчуo de Defeitos щ uma tщcnica que tem sido empregada amplamente para a construчуo de sistemas que precisam ser altamente confiсveis. Dentre as atividades de Injeчуo de Defeitos, existem estudos que englobam a injeчуo de defeitos de hardware e de software. Observa-se que existem poucos trabalhos relacionados р injeчуo de defeitos de software na literatura, assim como modelos de defeitos e mщtodos de injeчуo relacionados. Desse modo, o objetivo deste trabalho щ estudar modelos de defeitos de software e investigar mщtodos de injeчуo, baseado nos conceitos e princэpios oriundos do critщrio Anсlise de Mutantes. Dada a crescente complexidade dos sistemas computacionais, o projeto e a implementaчуo de uma ferramenta de suporte р atividade de injeчуo tornam-se necessсrios. Dessa forma, neste trabalho щ apresentada uma ferramenta de injeчуo de defeitos de software, denominada ITool, baseada em um esquema de injeчуo de defeitos. Esse esquema caracteriza o mapeamento de uma taxonomia de defeitos de software (Taxonomia de DeMillo) para os operadores de mutaчуo do critщrio de teste Anсlise de Mutantes para a linguagem C. Para ilustrar a relevтncia e a factibilidade das idщias exploradas neste trabalho, conduziu-se um experimento piloto utilizando-se o programa Space, um sistema real desenvolvido pela ESA (European Space Agency).

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: Uma Contribuiчуo ao Projeto Arquitetural de Ambientes de Engenharia de Software

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: NAKAGAWA, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Yumi;Nakagawa, Elisa Y.;Nakagawa, E. Y.;NAKAGAWA, ELISA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Recently, a proliferation of Software Engineering tools and environments has been observed, with positive impact on software production. However, despite reuse being the focus of many research in Software Engineering area, most tools and environments have been built individually, without attention in the reuse of development efforts. Moreover, there is a lack of works that propose reference architectures to these environments what can be influencing in the difficulties of evolution and integration that these environments have been suffered. In this context, this paper propose a mechanism to facilitate the development of Software Engineering tools and environments forWeb platform, aiming at low cost in development and maintenance. In particular, a aspect-based reference architecture for Software Engineering environments is established, aiming at attempting the continuous evolution and facilities of use and integration required by these environments. Also, a case study is conducted, establishing a reference architecture for Software Testing domain. From this case study experience, a preliminary process to develop Software Engineering environments based on architectural instantiation and specialization is established.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Arquiteturas de Software para Sistemas de Varejo: Um Mapeamento Sistemсtico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo: Atualmente, o com ercio varejista desempenha um papel fundamental na economia, como intermediador entre a ind ustria e o consumidor nal. A diversidade de tipos de varejo existente cria uma desigualdade no mercado que e altamente competitivo, no qual, gerenciar seus processos e extrair informa чѕes relevantes para tomadas de decisуo sуo de extrema importтncia para essas organiza чѕes. A informatiza чуo do processo destas organizaчѕes, agregando suas regras de neg ocio ao sistema de software, torna-se uma ferramenta decisiva para auxiliar o gerenciamento da empresa. Portanto, este trabalho tem o objetivo de realizar um levantamento das pesquisas que abordaram sistemas de varejo, e que utilizaram a Arquitetura de Software em sua representa чуo. Para tanto, utilizou-se a t ecnica do Mapeamento Sistem atico de Estudos, que foi proposta pela Engenharia de Software Baseada em Evidъncias (ESBE), que consiste em identi car, analisar e mapear determinada area do conhecimento, de modo a obter respostas para algumas questѕes previamente estabelecidas. Os resultados alcan cados mostram que h a uma concentra чуo de estudos voltados principalmente a sistemas de varejo para plataforma WEB, e o uso do SOA como soluчуo para problemas de integra чуo do sistema e entre sistemas. Este estudo pode subsidiar novas discussѕes e pesquisas sobre o tema abordado.
